title: The Penguin Book of Japanese Short Stories
author: Jay Rubin

highlights.text: his body seemed to lift off the ground as his spirits soared.
Orientals just can’t deal with a full dose of excitement. They’re not up to it physically.

One gains opportunities to observe the hidden truths of society and to touch the genuine tears of life. Oh, but once one has returned to the land of one’s birth – there is no place more constricting – one’s surroundings no longer permit such freedom, and one can no longer simply transcend the demands of social position.
Why did my parents not simply turn their backs on a son who had proved himself so unfilial?
Why, when he tried to force himself not to feel such gratitude, did he succeed only in filling himself with pain and dread?

I am certain you have seen sparrows that have built nests in the eaves of your home. No sooner do the young fly away from the nest than they escape forever from this fateful shadow. Nor do the parents make any attempt to bind their offspring’s hearts with morality.
